title: Were UK Midwives Encouraged To Say ‘Chestfeeding’ To Be More Inclusive?
subtitle: Adding new words is not the same as banishing the old ones.
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: A maternity department at a U.K. hospital announced in February 2021 that it was expanding terms it used in maternity care to include, for example, "chestfeeding" and "pregnant people," in order to be more inclusive of trans and nonbinary patients.
